lead_paragraph: Whether bias-reduction programs can lead to lasting change in policing is an unanswered question. And experts say some programs may even backfire.

byline.original: By BENEDICT CAREY and ERICA GOODE

headline.print_headline: Real-World Pressures Blunt Effect of Bias Training for Police, Experts Say
headline.main: Police Try to Lower Racial Bias, but Under Pressure, It Isn’t So Easy

snippet: Whether bias-reduction programs can lead to lasting change in policing is an unanswered question. And experts say some programs may even backfire....
abstract: Recent wave of fatal encounters between blacks and police officers seem to show increased efforts to train officers to handle such situations have produced mixed results; studies show officers behave differently in simulations than they do in actual, real-world situations; some experts suggest training may even backfire.
